data.text:
Nextdoor is in neighbourhoods nationwide.

Tap into your neighbourhood with Nextdoor. Find recommendations for businesses near you, search Nextdoor Finds to buy and sell great stuff, join groups to connect with neighbours. The possibilities nearby are endless.

Use Nextdoor to stay informed about whatâs going on in your community. Find home services, learn about local business openings or get to know the people you see every day.

Welcome the new kids on the street, keep up with local news, plan a nearby event or share recommendations.

From community activities to street parties, neighbours can connect in many ways. Nextdoor makes it easy to meet neighbours who have similar interests.

WHAT MAKES NEXTDOOR THE #1 APP FOR NEIGHBOURS

Stay Connected

â¢ Keep up-to-date on all the neighbourhood happenings

â¢ Get offers & free stuff when a neighbour sells that chair she no longer needs

â¢ Meet your neighbours and finally call that nice man down the street by name

See What's Happening Nearby

â¢ Find local events like barbecues, arts festivals and community activities

â¢ Discover jumble sales and clothing swaps

â¢ Learn about restaurants and shops near you

Find Home Services & Deals

â¢ Hire a local babysitter or recommend a nanny

â¢ Locate a pet sitter or dog walker for your furry friend

â¢ Find discounts offered by nearby businesses

HEAR WHAT NEIGHBOURS HAVE TO SAY ABOUT NEXTDOOR

âBefore Nextdoor, I didnât know there were several qualified babysitters living nearby and looking for work. It was easy to feel comfortable hiring my neighbourâs daughter to watch my son after school.â - Patrick

âThis year for Spring Cleaning, we wanted to sell old appliances, tools, clothing and electronics on Nextdoor Finds. In no time, our neighbours stopped by to make a deal and take things off our hands. It was easier than anything else, and it feels good knowing our old stuff has found a new home in the neighbourhood.â - Dan

OUR PURPOSE

At Nextdoor, we believe that by bringing neighbours together, we can cultivate a kinder world where everyone has a neighbourhood they can rely on.

YOUR PRIVACY

Nextdoor is a trusted environment where all neighbours are verified, making it safe to share online the kinds of things you'd be okay sharing with your neighbours in person.

Here's how:

â¢ Every neighbour verifies their address

â¢ All members go by their real names, just like in person

Connect with us:

https://www.facebook.com/nextdoor

https://twitter.com/nextdoor

https://instagram.com/nextdoor

Continued use of Location Services running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life. Nextdoor doesn't run Location Services in the background unless you give us permission by turning on optional features that require it.

Terms: nextdoor.co.uk/member_agreement

Privacy: nextdoor.co.uk/privacy_policy

Stu Worrall ,

Somethings not right

This may be pure coincidence. But I doubt it. Since installing this app a couple of years ago. Iâve not been able to shut my account down. I have had hundreds of spam/fishing scam emails that I never used to get since installing this app. I have also had an increase in cold callers ringing my phone during my work hours and two attempts at accessing my bank account through digital transactions claiming to be the Apple App Store. A while ago I tested a theory and went onto the Nextdoor app and spent around 30 minutes just browsing all the hate racism and negativity thatâs posted on it. After leaving the app I opened my emails to find I had to log into my email account as it had flagged six failed attempted logins whilst I was in the app. Shortly after I received a notification of a failed charge to my iTunes account for Â£12:99. It was listed as an itinerary nes purchase. So I contacted Apple support who

Could find no record of any charge to my account. I now have Apple investigating what data is shared and sold by the Nextdoor app. The charge to my account was not a one off. It has happened a number of times but I never realised it could have been linked to the app until I started to put 2 and 2 together and finally realised it was only happening when this app is active.

Developer Response ,

Hi Stu, thanks for sharing your feedback. We'd love to learn more about what we can do to make your experience on Nextdoor better - please don't hesitate to update your review here with more info, or let us know directly by writing in, here: https://nxdr.co/apps. Thanks again!

Rp809 ,

Disappointing and depressing to find out who you live amongst

Donât think Iâve written an app review before, such is my disappointment with this app. I live in a nice area; I was hoping that it would be heartwarming to see how my community join together and a good way to get involved with the community or find people with similar interests but frankly wish I hadnât joined because Iâve discovered how sneery and judgemental some of my neighbours are at heart. The amount of neighbours who jump to conclusions and think the worst of people in our community are too widespread. It largely becomes a wingeing forum. Iâve mostly been just a passive observer but sometimes I pick people up on their comments and then itâs a pile-on to me. This also occurred when Iâve posted a question - the arrogant and demeaning replies left me feeling negative. Iâve not seen overtly racist comments. The for sale listings were fine (unlike in some other reviews) but you can get that functionality on other common platforms. I suppose the only positive was the lost and find- frequently lost bank cards or keys or pets finding their way back to their owner. All in all the negatives far outweigh the positives and made me sad that these are people I live amongst, so Iâve deleted the app and deactivated the account. Iâm feeling better already; I guess ignorance is bliss. Weâll just have to hope we donât lose bank cards or keys!

Developer Response ,

Hi neighbour,

Thank you for your review.

We're sorry to hear about the negative posting in your area, along with posts that go against the guidelines. It's a real shame when this happens because we want the platform to be a useful and helpful tool to bring your community together.

Nextdoor do not moderate content centrally, with nearly three million neighbours we rely on neighbours and leads to report any violations to us directly.

If you do notice any violation of our Community Guidelines, you can either report content, report neighbour or get in touch with us directly here; Bit.ly/contactNextdoor and we promise to help you as soon as possible.

Hopefully we can help resolve any issues you are having and it would be great to see you give Nextdoor another try and connect with your neighbours!

Mollie, Nextdoor Support
